title: Red Sox reportedly place reliever Jordan Hicks on IL after latest implosion
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox placed reliever Jordan Hicks on the 15-day injured list with a shoulder injury before playing the Diamondbacks.
Hicks has struggled with an 8.20 ERA over 21 appearances, contributing to recent losses, including against the Guardians.
Lefty Chris Murphy is expected to join the bullpen as Hicks deals with performance issues and a lingering contract.

title: Derrick White gets candid about ‘different’ season that awaits Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Celtics face a challenging 2025-26 season after trading Jrue Holiday and Kristaps Porzingis to manage luxury taxes.
Star Jayson Tatum's Achilles injury likely sidelines him for entire season, impacting Celtics' competitive outlook.
Derrick White discusses Celtics' new dynamics and his own uncertain role as the team undergoes significant changes.

title: Report of suspicious man approaching Arlington child ‘unfounded,’ police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Arlington police closed the investigation of a suspicious man allegedly approaching a child, labeling the report as unfounded.
Police interviewed witnesses and reviewed surveillance footage but found insufficient evidence to continue the investigation.
The incident reportedly involved a masked man attempting to grab an 11-year-old boy on Waldo Road in Arlington.

title: Man who threatened pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge facing assault charge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matthew Freeman from North Billerica charged with assault and battery with a dangerous weapon and civil rights violation.
Incident involved Freeman allegedly brandishing a hatchet and threatening pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge in August.
Victim Fawaz Abusharkh, represented by CAIR-MA, was allegedly struck by Freeman's car during the protest.

title: Patriots’ Will Campbell lands on injury report ahead of season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookie left tackle Will Campbell is listed as a limited participant on the injury report due to an ankle issue.
Christian Gonzalez, out since July with a hamstring injury, didn't practice, while Christian Barmore had limited reps for non-injury reasons.
Campbell's absence could impact the Patriots against the Raiders, where Maxx Crosby poses a significant pass-rush threat.

title: Invasive seaweed stinks up one of the North Shore’s favorite seaside spots
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Invasive Japanese seaweed, heterosiphonia japonica, is causing a foul odor at Good Harbor Beach in Gloucester.
Hurricane Erin's strong winds washed large amounts of the seaweed ashore, where it is decomposing.
First detected in 2008, the invasive seaweed now spans from Nova Scotia to Long Island's south side.

title: Police: Suspect caused ATM explosion in Woburn, prompting FBI investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An ATM explosion at Eastern Bank in Woburn involved a suspected pipe bomb, prompting an FBI investigation.
The explosion occurred on Thursday morning after a man placed and detonated a device on the ATM.
No injuries were reported, and the suspect remains at large; authorities urge public to report any information.

title: Canton man arrested in Dorchester murder
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Jordan Evans, 32, was arrested in Canton for the murder of Shakar Caterson in Dorchester on May 3.
Shakar Caterson, 35, was shot near Blue Hill Avenue and Georgia Street and died at a hospital.
Evans faces charges including murder and firearm violation; arraignment set in Roxbury Municipal Court.

title: New England governors back wind energy as Trump escalates his attacks on industry
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Five New England governors, including Maura Healey, urge the Trump administration to support offshore wind projects and permits.
President Trump continues efforts to inhibit offshore wind industry, citing unverified claims and halting significant developments.
New Hampshire's Republican Governor Kelly Ayotte retracts support for offshore wind, diverging from neighboring states' stance.

title: Read a statement from the fiancé of Shrewsbury father shot and killed after walking son to school
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Kevin Doherty, 56, was shot and killed on Aug. 28 after walking his son to Calvin Coolidge Elementary School.
Snehal A. Srivastava, 26, allegedly shot Doherty while Doherty was on the phone with a police dispatcher.
A vigil and fundraiser for Doherty will be held on Oct. 11 at SAC Park, supported by the Shrewsbury community.
